name: Remember Tony Curtis? Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: Curtis had a memorable role in "Spartacus". How did he die in the movie?
options: Killed in combat fighting the Romans
questions.explanation:
Killed in a sword fight.

	Curtis played Antoninus. He dies in a sword fight with Kirk Douglas at the end of the movie - each trying to spare the other the pain of being crucified. Great movie. With a stellar cast: Charles Laughton, Laurence Olivier, Peter Ustinov and Jean Simmons.

questions.text: In "Trapeze", Curtis and Burt Lancaster clash over a woman. Who was she?
questions.explanation:
Gina Lollobrigida.

	Good action/romance movie in a circus setting. Curtis and Lancaster are a trapeze team. Lollobrigida wants to be a star - but is a bit short of talent.

questions.text: In "The Defiant Ones", Curtis is paired with Sidney Poitier. How does the movie end?
options: Poitier escapes, but Curtis is captured
Curtis escapes, but Poitier is captured
questions.explanation:
Both are captured.

	Early Hollywood treatment of racial tensions. Fine movie by Stanley Kramer, but the end - in which both men are captured - leaves something to be desired.

questions.text: In "Some Like It Hot", Curtis does a fine voice impersonation of this actor.
questions.explanation:
Cary Grant.

	Curtis stars with Jack Lemmon and Marilyn Monroe in this Billy Wilder comedy. His impression of Cary Grant is actually quite good.

questions.text: Curtis is the star of "Taras Bulba", but he does not play the title role. What is the relation of the character played by Curtis to Taras?
questions.explanation:
Son.

	Curtis is the son of Taras (played nicely by Yul Brynner). Curtis gets in trouble when he falls for the wrong woman - future wife Christine Kaufman. Good action/romance story.

questions.text: In "The Boston Strangler", Curtis plays a man who suffers from what psychological problems?
questions.explanation:
Multiple Personality.

	Curtis plays Albert DeSalvo, the Boston Strangler. Henry Fonda is the police investigator. DeSalvo is depicted in the movie as having two personalities - each unaware of the other one. Nice job by Curtis in an unfamiliar type of role.

questions.text: Which of these movies did Curtis make with one-time wife Janet Leigh?
questions.explanation:
Perfect Furlough.

	"Furlough" was a light comedy which starred the two of them. "Curtis also starred in "Impostor", about a man who successfully pulled off many impersonations. True story. Not bad. Leigh was in "Harper" (as Paul Newman's ex-wife) and in ""Manchurian", but Curtis wasn't in either of those two movies.

questions.text: In "The Outsider", Curtis plays a WWII soldier with an unusual background. What is it?
questions.explanation:
He is an American Indian.

	Curtis plays Ira Heyes, a Pima Indian, who is one of the soldiers photographed raising the flag on Iwo Jima. Unfortunately, Heyes had trouble with fame. True story, well-done.

questions.text: In "Sweet Smell of Success", Curtis plays a lackey who wants to impress a big shot. Who plays the latter role?
questions.explanation:
Burt Lancaster.

	The dark side of business. Will Curtis do "anything" for success? Nice job by both leads. Lancaster's character was said to be fashioned after Walter Winchell.

questions.text: In "Kings Go Forth", Curtis stars in a romantic triangle that is set in WWII. Who is his co-star?
questions.explanation:
Frank Sinatra.

	Sinatra and Curtis are rivals (of sorts) for Natalie Wood: Sinatra is the "straight" guy and Curtis is the scoundrel. Nicely done.
